page.title: 14Evening Telegraph
page.content: { The Evening Telegraph,}Peterborough's daily newspaper, is 24 years old in 1985 and costs 16 pence per night, for an average 32 page issue. It is enjoying its best spell where sales are concerned and for the third successive time (sixth-monthly audited figures) has earned the title, 'Britain's fastest growing evening newspaper' (32,000 nightly). The content is a mixture of advertising and news, broken down to international national and local items, with sports pages at the back and a number of regular features. It is produced by a total staff of around 180 people on a site at Woodston, 45 of them being journalists. Their stories are rekeyed by printers using visual display units and the 'type' is produced by a computer for pasting up on the page prior to printing.
